history.content:
Follow the procedure here:   https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cpt

When Prof Hilfinger emails you approval, let him know you would prefer to do the work in the summer but receive the unit of credit in F18.  I'm sure you/he can figure the rest out.

Note: For international students, to be able to use the CPT for visa purposes, you need to sign up for units in the summer.

Follow the procedure here:   https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cpt

When Prof Hilfinger emails you approval, let him know you would prefer to do the work in the summer but receive the unit of credit in F18.  I'm sure you/he can figure the rest out.
Does anyone have any update on this/done this before? I just followed the instructors’ response and emailed professor hilfinger but he says he doesnt know anything about this

children.subject: Its definitely just something with the EECS department, because I know that Haas has a 0-unit CPT course for its students..

Hi there, 


We have made requests to the campus for a 0 unit CPT course (I have even drafted a proposal) and they have been denied. This is not an "EECS Department" decision.

Thanks Nicole! I know that the EECS department tries to really cater to its students in a way that no department does and it is a pity that UC Berkeley has not been able to notice (or that has deliberately ignored) this need. Thanks again for always being on top of students needs (even tho we are so many in the department) :)
Aw, that's sweet, Thanks! Just want y'all to know we're really trying.

Hi Fang. OP here. So I emailed Hilfinger and he seemed pretty buzzed by my question and his literal answer was "technically, this would be illegal" and then when I asked about this being done in the past (aside: I am almost sure I read about this happening a year ago or so in Piazza) he said that he had no idea about that and that he had never dealt with a case like this. I was surprised by this because I have many friends who will intern this summer, also internationals, in other schools who do not face these fees. I guess it is something we will have to deal with until the EECS department comes up with an international-friendly solution for people doing internships during the summer (I do appreciate the fact that EECS makes a course for us to take and we only have to pay Summer tuition and and Campus fee summing up to $700, but a more optimal solution for international students in the future should address this problem and provide a 0-unit CPT course or something similar as in other schools)

history.content: I remember reading like a year ago or so that the CS department, upon request, will waive charges for CPT during the summer and simply add the unit as an extra unit during the fall. How would the procedure for this work?
history.subject: [CPT] Waive units until the fall?
